truth: -  "Organic chemistry is the study of the structure, properties, composition, reactions, and synthesis of organic compounds that contain carbon atoms."
fiction: -  "Organic chemistry is the study of the structure, properties, composition, reactions, and synthesis of organic compounds that contain neon atoms."

truth: -  "Alkanes are hydrocarbons that only contain single bonds."
fiction: -  "Alkanes are hydrocarbons that only contain triple bonds."

truth: -  "Alkenes are hydrocarbons that contain a carbon-carbon double bond."
fiction: -  "Alkenes are hydrocarbons that contain a carbon-oxygen double bond."

truth: -  "Alkynes are hydrocarbons that contain a carbon-carbon triple bond."
fiction: -  "Alkynes are hydrocarbons that contain a carbon-hydrogen triple bond."

truth: -  "Aromatic compounds, also known as arenes, are organic compounds that contain a ring of carbon atoms with alternating single and double bonds."
fiction: -  "Aromatic compounds, also known as arenes, are organic compounds that contain a ring of nitrogen atoms with alternating single and double bonds."

truth: -  "Functional groups are specific groups of atoms within molecules that are responsible for the characteristic chemical reactions of those molecules."
fiction: -  "Functional groups are specific groups of atoms within molecules that are responsible for the characteristic color of those molecules."

truth: -  "Esters are organic compounds that are derived from carboxylic acids and alcohols."
fiction: -  "Esters are organic compounds that are derived from noble gases and metals."

truth: -  "Alcohols are organic compounds that contain one or more hydroxyl (-OH) groups attached to a carbon atom."
fiction: -  "Alcohols are organic compounds that contain one or more helium (-He) groups attached to a carbon atom."

truth: -  "Carboxylic acids are organic compounds that contain a carboxyl (-COOH) group."
fiction: -  "Carboxylic acids are organic compounds that contain a carbide (-C≡C-) group."

truth: -  "Amines are organic compounds and functional groups that contain a basic nitrogen atom with a lone pair."
fiction: -  "Amines are organic compounds and functional groups that contain a basic oxygen atom with a lone pair."

truth: -  "Amides are organic compounds that contain a carbonyl group (C=O) linked to a nitrogen atom."
fiction: -  "Amides are organic compounds that contain a carbonyl group (C=O) linked to a helium atom."

truth: -  "Ethers are a class of organic compounds that contain an ether group — an oxygen atom connected to two alkyl or aryl groups."
fiction: -  "Ethers are a class of organic compounds that contain an ether group — a neon atom connected to two alkyl or aryl groups."

truth: -  "Ketones are organic compounds that contain a carbonyl group (C=O) bonded to two other carbon atoms."
fiction: -  "Ketones are organic compounds that contain a carbonyl group (C=O) bonded to two other helium atoms."

truth: -  "Aldehydes are organic compounds that contain a carbonyl group (C=O) bonded to a hydrogen atom and another carbon atom."
fiction: -  "Aldehydes are organic compounds that contain a carbonyl group (C=O) bonded to a hydrogen atom and another neon atom."

truth: -  "Organic reactions are chemical reactions involving organic compounds."
fiction: -  "Organic reactions are physical reactions involving organic compounds."

truth: -  "In organic chemistry, a hydrocarbon is any the vast family of compounds made up of hydrogen and carbon."
fiction: -  "In organic chemistry, a hydrocarbon is any the vast family of compounds made up of hydrogen and neon."

truth: -  "In organic chemistry, isomers are molecules with the same molecular formula but different structural formulas."
fiction: -  "In organic chemistry, isomers are molecules with the same molecular formula but different atomic weight."

truth: -  "In organic chemistry, a substitution reaction is a type of reaction where one functional group in a chemical compound is replaced by another group."
fiction: -  "In organic chemistry, a substitution reaction is a type of reaction where one functional group in a chemical compound is replaced by another element."

truth: -  "In organic chemistry, an addition reaction is a reaction where atoms or groups are added to opposite ends of a double or triple bond."
